website_summaries.verdict: The advantage of this brand is the taste, which is very close to that of wheat pasta.
pros: Blends rice and corn for a very good effect when it comes to texture and taste
cons: Cook time on this pasta is going to be a bit longer than a regular wheat pasta

customer_reviews.title: pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a fan of Barilla, especially not their prepared foods. We usually get DeCecco pasta, or Uncle Ranas fresh (omg yum). BUT I've had to switch to a gluten free diet; my husband is 100% Italian and we both know a good pasta when we eat it. It's been tough to find a good gluten free pasta that acts and tastes like regular pasta. This is one of the better gluten free pastas we've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Me Myself and I

customer_reviews.title: Close match to "real" pasta
customer_reviews.text: For those trying to avoid gluten this is a great alternative, the pasta really does not taste much different especially when mixing with regular sauces. If you are eating all by itself you can tell the difference. I have other types of gluten free pasta and it cooks into an almost glue like form, this cooks normally and doesn't get sticky like other brands.
customer_reviews.author: DGS4930Top Contributor: Diving

customer_reviews.title: It is hard to find Barilla gluten-free pasta where I ...
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to find Barilla gluten-free pasta where I live so I order it online. I find the taste is about the same as other pasta that is not gluten-free. I did have to cook it a little longer than normal.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer B

customer_reviews.title: The BEST!
customer_reviews.text: The BEST gluten free pasta I have found! The texture, consistency and taste are identical to the regular. It is also durable, unlike most gluten free pastas it won't turn into mush if you let it boil too long. It also does fantastic reheated in the microwave! It's the only one I buy.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa English

customer_reviews.title: I would have thought Barilla would have done better
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with this product. It just did not cook up well. I have used another brand that is far better than this that holds up, even if you have to reheat some of what might be left over. I thought I would try the Barilla because I have used their regular pasta before I changed to gluten free. I would have continued purchasing my favorite brand, but the price on Amazon was outlandish. Thus, I am seeking another source for it. Many gluten free products are overpriced and not good enough to warrant their high prices. Obviously, I shall not purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Best Pasta
customer_reviews.text: I never liked pasta, but since needing to go gluten free I tried these, best pasta I ever ate!!!!! Will order again...
customer_reviews.author: B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad
customer_reviews.text: Impressed with the quality after cooking. Held together than some other gluten free pastas tried with good color. Taste - ok for being gluten free.
customer_reviews.author: hoodoo

customer_reviews.title: Elbows had quality control problems but the rest was great
customer_reviews.text: The flavor and the texture are great. My only problem was that the elbows in the 3-pack had some (quite a few) that were not hollow. They were solid and so of course they didn't cook correctly and became a gummy mass which is not pleasant to bite into when you're chewing noodles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gluten free product!
customer_reviews.text: Closest thing I have found to "regular" pasta. It has a great consistency. The only negative thing I can think of is that it isn't as good the day after.
customer_reviews.author: Annegirl

customer_reviews.title: Just like regular pasta
customer_reviews.text: Used this to make baked macaroni for Christmas. Could not tell the difference between this and regular pasta. I will continue to purchase since emy husband has a gluten allergy.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Beckemeyer

customer_reviews.title: This product is overpriced and arrived all banged up
customer_reviews.text: Barilla puts out a good product but I accidentally paid $5 a box. Not cool. Grocery stores sell it for 3. The package arrived in a soft plastic envelope that had been roughly handled. The box corners were all crushed in.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew J Gunther

customer_reviews.title: SO EXCITED TO FIND DECENT GLUTEN FREE PASTA
customer_reviews.text: It has been an uphill battle to find GF pasta that doesn't disintegrate when it is cooked and has a decent flavor. Thank you Barilla for saving the day!
customer_reviews.author: Robbie

customer_reviews.title: Misleading
customer_reviews.text: I must have read this wrong, lot of money for three boxes. Should really look at what is posted
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer stark

customer_reviews.title: Taste like whole what pasta without the gluten. Somehow Barilla has done the best job!
customer_reviews.text: The only gluten free pasta that tastes like 'regular' pasta. Amazon is the best way to buy because it's the least expensive! Now off to make some...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but no other complaints
customer_reviews.text: Pricey but it's gf and buying online due to covid. As expected. Happy to have it as I'll probably be home till augo.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Guldan

customer_reviews.title: Price per box
customer_reviews.text: I paid 15 dollars for 3 small boxes of GF pasta. This price is outrageous! There NO return policy I could have bought 9 boxes with this price. I thought I was buys 3 sets now there’s no way to return
customer_reviews.author: Erik Kelling

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for gluten free.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good for gluten free pasta. Works best if you do not overlook it. A bit pricey for pasta.
customer_reviews.author: CMama

customer_reviews.title: Nice variety!
customer_reviews.text: Gave me the opportunity to to sample different types to see which ones I liked the best
customer_reviews.author: A. Christine Biggers

customer_reviews.title: Delicious!
customer_reviews.text: I’m new to GF and enjoy having options for pasta
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Sutcliffe

customer_reviews.title: Pasta Great
customer_reviews.text: The gluten-free pasta was a hit even though my husband does not need to eat gluten free. However, I paid full free for the three packages of pasta and only two packages were gluten free. I would not order again.
customer_reviews.author: londongrammy

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This is great one of each of my faves. Wish they made angle hair.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole O.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Received the wrong item. It was not gluten free. Gave it away.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Pasta did not "overcook" quickly like most gluten free pasta does
customer_reviews.text: Pasta did not "overcook" quickly like most gluten free pasta does. Barilla held its body and consistency, flavorful and has worked with a number of recipes, including Alfredo, marinara.
customer_reviews.author: none

customer_reviews.title: Excellent-Tasting Gluten Free Pasta!
customer_reviews.text: Best-tasting gluten-free pasta I've ever had. I'm celiac but my husband is not. He can't tell the difference between this pasta and regular pasta!
customer_reviews.author: Pilotgal

customer_reviews.title: Picture is a lie
customer_reviews.text: The picture and description is misleading. I thought I order three different pastas but I received 3 boxes of penne pasta.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is hands down the best gluten free pasta I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the best gluten free pasta I've ever had, and I'm picky about gluten free food. My family didn't even notice the difference between this and regular pasta! So good.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: The best of all gluten free pastas I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: The best of all gluten free pastas I've ever had! Rated the best by major newspapers Taste Section. They were right!
customer_reviews.author: dms

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it, very hard to find good gluten free pasta, this is one of the better ones
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customerkwillis

customer_reviews.title: it's nice to have a great tasting
customer_reviews.text: Having by necessity to be gluten free, it's nice to have a great tasting alternative
customer_reviews.author: MamieDean

customer_reviews.title: Choice A
customer_reviews.text: Best gluten free pasta we have found - and we've tried a lot of different brands.
customer_reviews.author: MO

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gluten free pasta
customer_reviews.text: Perfect gluten free pasta. Local stores do not currently carry this product, so this was a great find for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced for three boxes. A more recent offer was ...
customer_reviews.text: Overpriced for three boxes. A more recent offer was priced $16 for eight 12oz boxes of Rotini. There was an $8 return postage fee.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Really Good
customer_reviews.text: Tried a lot of pasta since going gluten free. These are some of the best we've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: While barilla is the best gluten free pasta. This was not a good price . You can get 8 for close to this price . I bought by mistake and when I wanted to return - no returns . Buyer beware and it’s an amazon choice product😮
customer_reviews.author: Jonesy

customer_reviews.title: Great product, however . . .
customer_reviews.text: I love the Barilla GF pastas. Best I have found for GF needs. Cooks well, keeps its shape, flavor is great. However, I only gave this particular product a 4-star rating because it is cheaper in other supermarkets, Free Meyer, Walmart, and Winco that I know of.
customer_reviews.author: PattyCakes

customer_reviews.title: Good Taste
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Barilla pasta for quite a while. My favorite has been the Barilla Plus, which I use in several different shapes, including rotini, elbows, penne, farfalle, the bowtie shape, and spaghetti. I was happy to try my favorite pasta in the new gluten free variety. It has only two ingredients: corn and rice. The Barilla instructions say that the pasta cooks in about ten minutes, although I give it a few more minutes. You can compare this variety to the other kinds, but it stands on its own. The texture and taste are good. I like this new pasta.
customer_reviews.author: PaulM

customer_reviews.title: Good taste
customer_reviews.text: Good taste for gluten free. I just wish the price for gluten free would come down.
customer_reviews.author: Whodatgrl

customer_reviews.title: Over $8.00 A Box
customer_reviews.text: This is actually really good pasta for being gluten free. I usually buy it for a little over $2.16 a box by the case for the elbows, since we use a lot of it. At over $8.00 a box for the combo pack, we just couldn't do it.
customer_reviews.author: Truth Seeker

customer_reviews.title: I will search out this pasta. I have tried ...
customer_reviews.text: I will search out this pasta. I have tried possibly every gluten free brand (at least 6 different ones) and this pasta is in a class of its own. If only my local grocery store didnt stop carrying it I wouldnt be here. For those of you complaining about the price its showing 15$ for all 3 boxes which isn't 8$ a box and honestly even if it was I would probably still get it because you cant put a price on being able to have real pasta again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: very difficult to find pasta that tastes as good as this does. Impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: For the three items the price is way to high.
customer_reviews.author: James linden

product_meta.title: Barilla Gluten Free Pasta Sampler Pack of 3 - Penne, Rotini, Elbows 12 oz each
product_meta.description: Introducing a new line of Gluten-Free pasta that has the great taste and texture you expect from Italy's #1 pasta brand. Feel good about including Barilla Gluten Free in your favorite pasta dishes so that everyone in your family can enjoy the pasta they love together.
feature_bullets: Great Tast, Made with Corn and Rice
Sample Pack of 3 styles of Pasta - Rotini, Penne, and Elbows
Produced in a dedicated Gluten-Free Facility.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
